item.title: Five things I learnt from: 2020
item.description: I vividly remember writing this piece up, in the same place, with same keystrokes and having same enthusiasm last year, so much so, that in my gut, I feel my past and present have somehow interlaced, conspiring against my sanity – experiencing both moments at once.

item.title: Strains of thought
item.description: Little Sparks on your mind Bright, timid and of different kind,

item.title: Dichotomy
item.description: I drew it on a moonless night but the lines came to me on a sunny afternoon.

item.title: The Biggest Story
item.description: Entropy and Life Entropy is the measure of disorderliness, in oddly simple terms.

item.description: Allow me to show you a world in some color.

item.description: There are a lot of platforms to develop a Chatbot in the market today, some where you do not even need to write a single line of code.

item.title: Five things I learnt from: THE GENE
item.description: The world has never seen a quarantine like this, it is a great time to get a crash course in genetics.

item.title: Five things I learnt from: 2019
item.description: I have written a couple of blogs on my site by now - I pick a book, try to comprehend it and share with you all of what I loved the most about it, business as usual.

item.title: Factfulness
item.description: Factfulness, by Hans Rosling So this year, I took a bold New Year Resolution: “50 Books a Year”.

item.title: Eudaimonia
item.description: Humans appeared on earth around 200,000 years ago but most human advancements are from the last 500 years.

item.description: XOR is one of the most interesting logical operation but it is definitive not made for encrypting.
